intro: Solanum multispinum, commonly known as the multispined nightshade, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its spiny stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes. Solanum multispinum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
